events.originalText: First Libyan Civil War: The United Nations Security Council adopted Resolution 1973, authorizing military intervention in Libya to protect civilians.
events.subtitle: Libyan civil war (2011)
events.headline: UN Security Council authorizes military intervention in Libya during First Libyan Civil War

events.originalText: Hundreds of followers of the Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God, a Ugandan sect, died in a mass murder committed by its leaders.
events.subtitle: Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God
events.headline: Mass murder in Uganda: Hundreds die in Ugandan sect led by Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God

events.originalText: In a referendum, nearly 70 percent of voters in nine Soviet republics agreed that the Soviet Union should be preserved.
events.subtitle: 1991 Soviet Union referendum
events.headline: Soviet Union preservation supported by 70% of voters in nine Soviet republics

events.originalText: Eritrean War of Independence: Eritrean People's Liberation Front troops encircled Ethiopian forces in the Battle of Afabet, gaining a decisive victory three days later.
events.subtitle: Eritrean War of Independence
events.headline: Eritrean forces gain decisive victory in Battle of Afabet during War of Independence

events.originalText: The Penmanshiel Tunnel in the Scottish Borders region of Scotland collapsed during refurbishing construction, killing two workers, and leading to the abandonment of the tunnel.
events.subtitle: Penmanshiel Tunnel
events.headline: Penmanshiel Tunnel collapse in Scotland kills two workers

events.originalText: Slava Veder took his Pulitzer Prize-winning photograph Burst of Joy, which came to symbolize the end of United States involvement in the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: Pulitzer Prize for Feature Photography
events.headline: Pulitzer Prize-winning photo symbolizes end of US involvement in Vietnam War

events.originalText: Golda Meir became the first female prime minister of Israel.
events.subtitle: Golda Meir
events.headline: Golda Meir becomes first female prime minister of Israel

events.originalText: Six thousand sheep were killed on ranches near Dugway Proving Ground in Utah as a result of the U.S. Army spraying a nerve agent.
events.subtitle: Dugway Proving Ground
events.headline: 6,000 sheep killed in Utah due to US Army nerve agent spraying

events.originalText: An eruption of Mount Agung on Bali, Indonesia, killed at least 1,100 people.
events.subtitle: Mount Agung
events.headline: Mount Agung eruption in Bali kills at least 1,100 people

events.originalText: A plane crash on the slopes of Mount Manunggal killed Philippine president Ramon Magsaysay and 24 others.
events.subtitle: 1957 Cebu Douglas C-47 crash
events.headline: Plane crash kills Philippine president Ramon Magsaysay and 24 others on Mount Manunggal

events.originalText: Ice hockey fans in Montreal rioted to protest the suspension of Montreal Canadiens star Maurice Richard for hitting an official.
events.subtitle: Ice hockey
events.headline: Montreal Canadiens star suspended, fans riot in Montreal

events.originalText: Scientists at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory announced the synthesis of californium, a radioactive transuranium element.
events.subtitle: Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory
events.headline: Scientists announce synthesis of californium at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory

events.originalText: The Holocaust: The first mass killings of Jews began at Belzec extermination camp in occupied Poland, the first of the Operation Reinhard camps to begin operation.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: First mass killings of Jews begin at Belzec extermination camp during the Holocaust

events.originalText: World War I: Hugh Grosvenor, 2nd Duke of Westminster led a force to rescue 92 prisoners of war from Bir Hakeim, killing the Senussi guards and their families.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Duke of Westminster leads force to rescue prisoners of war in World War I

events.originalText: The Dorchester Heights Monument, memorializing the siege of Boston during the American Revolutionary War, was dedicated.
events.subtitle: Dorchester Heights Monument
events.headline: Dorchester Heights Monument dedicated in memory of American Revolutionary War siege

events.originalText: The transatlantic steamship Utopia accidentally collided with the battleship HMS Anson in the Bay of Gibraltar, sinking in less than twenty minutes and killing 562.
events.subtitle: SS Utopia
events.headline: Transatlantic steamship Utopia sinks in collision, killing 562

events.originalText: The Female Relief Society of Nauvoo is formally organized with Emma Smith as president.
events.subtitle: Relief Society
events.headline: Female Relief Society of Nauvoo organized with Emma Smith as president

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: The 11‑month Siege of Boston ended with the evacuation of the city's British garrison.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Siege of Boston ends with British garrison evacuation in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Franco-Dutch War: France captured the town of Valenciennes in the Spanish Netherlands.
events.subtitle: Franco-Dutch War
events.headline: France captures Valenciennes in Franco-Dutch War

events.originalText: Reconquista: Combined Castilian and Murcian forces defeated the Emirate of Granada at the Battle of Los Alporchones around the city of Lorca.
events.subtitle: Reconquista
events.headline: Castilian and Murcian forces defeat Emirate of Granada at Battle of Los Alporchones in Reconquista

events.originalText: Edward the Black Prince (pictured) was created Duke of Cornwall, the first English dukedom.
events.subtitle: Edward the Black Prince
events.headline: Edward the Black Prince created Duke of Cornwall, first English dukedom

events.originalText: After arranging for the assassination of Valentinian III, Petronius Maximus secured the throne of the Western Roman Empire, only to be killed 11 weeks later during the sack of Rome.
events.subtitle: Valentinian III
events.headline: Petronius Maximus secures Western Roman Empire throne, killed during sack of Rome
